DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to evaluate the therapeutic efficacy and safety of two different paracetamol-containing solutions in postoperative dental pain. They will be compared to placebo (a dummy treatment which contains no active ingredient).
DOC.brief_title: Analgesic Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Two Paracetamol-containing Solutions in Post-Surgical Dental Pain
DOC.criteria: ASA I or II and scheduled for elective surgical extraction of 1 or more impacted mandibular 3rd molars, at least 1 of which must be a fully or partially impacted mandibular 3rd molar requiring mandibular bone removal. Moderate or severe pain within 4 hours after the completion of surgery. Another acute or chronic painful physical condition Use of any other analgesics (within 24 hours), sedatives, or narcotic drugs as well as microsomal enzyme inducers Inability to use and understand Visual Analog Scale and Verbal Rating Score
